text: it seems such she hasn't got off to the
smoothest start for some of the
journalists there to cover it
the BBC's Kevin Bishop arrived to find a
hotel reception with no floor but at
least it had this welcoming framed photo
when the guardians Moscow correspondent
arrived his hotel had no record of his
reservation this is what he found when
he tried to find solace in the bar and
things don't necessarily improve after
check-in CNN had 11 rooms but sports
producer Harry Ricci has been showing
off the one that was ready meanwhile one
blog editor from New Jersey found a
fitted toilet but not one that could be
flushed a water main burst at the hotel
of CTV journalist joy Malbin followed by
a power-cut Tribune reporter Stacey sent
Clair was apparently warned not to use
this tap water on her face because it
contained something dangerous a Calgary
Herald sports writer got an unwelcome
surprise when a light fixture fell a
foot from her bed on her second night in
Sochi and some found their fuse obscured
whether by cranes or leftover paint but
it's not all bad this US sports
journalist found her room with water
sheets and a view of the mountains and
while finished hotel rooms may be few
and far between
it seems that stunning vistas is one
thing Sochi isn't short of
